content: This South American country is home to the Amazon Rainforest, the largest tropical rainforest in the world, covering more than half of its territory. What is it called?

I believe the country you're referring to is Brazil. The Amazon Rainforest, often called the "lungs of the Earth," spans across several countries in South America, but the majority of it, more than half, is located within Brazil's borders. This vast ecosystem is incredibly biodiverse and plays a crucial role in global climate regulation.
